etymology.description: 𤣩(𤣩) (yù, "jade") provides the semantic meaning of jade + 黃(黃) (huáng, "yellow") serves as the phonetic component -> represents a semicircular jade piece
etymology.interpretation: The character 璜(璜) combines the semantic element 𤣩(𤣩) related to jade with the phonetic 黃(黃), illustrating a jade object with a similar pronunciation to 'yellow.' This specialized jade piece holds cultural significance.

examples.chinese: 皇后赠他璜(皇后贈他璜)，象征尊贵(象徵尊貴)。
examples.pinyin: Huánghòu zèng tā huáng, xiàngzhēng zūnguì.
examples.english: The empress gifted him a semicircular jade, symbolizing nobility.

examples.chinese: 他细细抚摸璜(他細細撫摸璜)，仿佛触摸历史(仿佛觸摸歷史)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xìxì fǔmō huáng, fǎngfú chùmō lìshǐ.
examples.english: He gently caressed the semicircular jade, as if he were touching history.
